## Aim

<p style="text-align: center;">
*"Our aim is to investigate genes being significant up- or down regulated in patients with urothelial carcinoma depending on whether or not they have metastasis. Moreover we want to explore the importance of smoking in regards to the gene expression."*
</p>

## Introduction
##### Bladder cancer

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
-   <span style="font-size: 0.7em;">Approx. 500,000 cases worldwide in 2020.</span>
-   <span style="font-size: 0.7em;">Smoking is considered to account for half of cases.</span>
-   <span style="font-size: 0.7em;">Only 5% diagnosed with metastasis in distant body parts. </span>
